instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D6990: What is D6990? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input, can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R6990: What is R6990? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on Macbooks from around the year 2012. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
threads.message:
hi
I have problem with board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 
When i plug magsafe it starts and works until power off system. I can power off working machine with power button. This is without battery.
When turned off don't react for power BTN.
Same situation if battery  is in, board start automatically but when power off next time can power on.
When I Short <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> it looks like smc reset, magsafe change color but don't start.
What i could do next.
I get this board not working with bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, blowed up <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>, <DIODE>D6990</DIODE>, <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>.
I change bad parts and stop on described problem.



Kindly Regards Mariusz

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
threads.message:
Firstly I tried new keyboard. 
Now I'm testing without keyboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
threads.message: Check if voltage on <CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR> is pulled low when pressing power button. Could be bad KBD connector or bad <RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR> are ok.
When I disconected keyboard and use power pad on board. I thought it was bad SMC and I changed it. But all without success.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
threads.message:
Again:
Check if voltage on <CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR> is pulled low when pressing power button. 

If not than bad keyboard or bad connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR> have 3,4V when untouched.
"When power is on Voltage is 0,4". -  I mean when I press the power button

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
threads.message:
[QUOTE="rzeszu, post: 4507"]<CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR> have 3,4V when untouched.
When power is on Voltage is 0,4.
[/QUOTE]

you mean "when power is on Voltage is 0,4" when you plugin cable you have 3,4V but when you press the powerbutton it goes down to 0,4V. and when you release button again it goes back to 3,4V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
threads.message:
Sorry for my english.
Situation looks like below.
When i have board without battery and plug cable it will turn on an i could use Power button to power off. After i power off I can't power on second time with button on keyboard or pads on board.
When I have board with battery and plug cable sometimes it power on automatically but  power button I can use only for power off working machine.
[I]"When power is on Voltage is 0,4.[/I] " i mean when i press the power button

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
threads.message: Disconnect battery indicator. If that does not help check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>, it should be high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on only once when plug cable
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R6961</RESISTOR> checked 100Ohm
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is High
Voltage is 3,4V when powered on and off.
